title: Problem Overview
content:
**Erdős Problem #217:** Find n points in R² in general position with n-1 distinct distances where the i-th distance appears exactly i times.

**Status: OPEN** - Known for n ≤ 8, conjectured impossible for large n.

title: Point and Distance
content:
**Point:** Element of EuclideanSpace R (Fin 2) = R².

**dist(p,q):** Euclidean distance ||p - q||.

title: PointConfiguration
content:
**PointConfiguration(n):** n distinct points in the plane.

The distinctness constraint ensures all points are different.

title: NoThreeCollinear
content:
**No three collinear:** No three points lie on a common line.

This is a standard "general position" constraint in discrete geometry.

title: NoFourConcyclic
content:
**No four concyclic:** No four points lie on a common circle.

This stronger constraint further restricts valid configurations.

title: InGeneralPosition
content:
**General position:** Both constraints together - no 3 collinear AND no 4 concyclic.

This severely limits possible configurations.

title: Distance Multiset
content:
**allDistances:** Multiset of all n(n-1)/2 pairwise distances.

**distinctDistances:** The set of unique distance values.

title: HasStaircaseMultiplicity
content:
**Staircase property:** There's an ordering d_1, ..., d_k of distinct distances where d_i appears exactly i times.

This elegant pattern: 1 + 2 + ... + (n-1) = n(n-1)/2 pairs.

title: HasErdos217Property
content:
**Full Erdős-217 property:**
1. General position
2. Exactly n-1 distinct distances
3. Staircase multiplicities

title: Erdos217Exists
content:
**Erdos217Exists(n):** There exists an n-point configuration with the Erdős-217 property.

The main question: for which n is this true?

title: n = 4 Case
content:
**n = 4 works:** Isosceles triangle with center point.

This gives 3 distinct distances with multiplicities 1, 2, 3.

title: Pomerance Construction
content:
**n = 5 (Pomerance):** Surprising construction refuting Erdős's belief that n ≥ 5 was impossible.

Shows the problem is harder than initially thought.

title: Palásti Constructions
content:
**n = 6, 7, 8 (Palásti):** Extended existence to all n ≤ 8.

Beyond n = 8, no constructions are known.

title: small_cases_exist
content:
**Theorem:** For n = 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, the Erdős-217 property is achievable.

Proof by cases using the axiomatized constructions.

title: Erdős's Conjecture
content:
**Conjecture:** There exists N such that for all n ≥ N, no Erdős-217 configuration exists.

Erdős believed the property fails for large n.

title: Counting Argument
content:
**Key observation:** 1 + 2 + ... + (n-1) = n(n-1)/2.

The staircase pattern accounts for EXACTLY all pairs. No slack!

title: erdos_217
content:
**Main Result:**
1. Small cases (n = 4..8) exist
2. Large n conjectured impossible

PROBLEM STATUS: OPEN
